result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kashmeir Lajames Sterling

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kashmeir Lajames Sterling in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Kashmeir Lajames Sterling.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has completed firearm safety class. The State moves to revoke the DPA offer, due to reasons put forth on the record. Court further advises parties that she will take the State's motion for revocation of the DPA offer under advisement. Case adjourned to Branch 17. 
Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Update 10-17-22- Sterling, Kashmeir Lajames.pdf

Defendant Kashmeir Lajames Sterling in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Defendant's Guilty Plea Questionnaire
Received and Filed. Elements: Carrying Concealed Weapon
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement

Defendant Kashmeir Lajames Sterling in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing.
Defense request an adjournment for reasons stated to the court.  
Parties advised    Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Court ordered case adjourned Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a calendar call. Defense requests to resolve the case through a DPA hearing.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.


Notes: Defendant appeared later and provided the next court date.
Case Calendared for a Status Conference. Defendant failed to appear. Court is in trial and ordered case adjourned for a Calendar Call on 6-8-2022 at 8:30am.

Defendant Kashmeir Lajames Sterling in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Status Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Case is tentatively in a DPA posture. Defendant has completed the Tad evaluation and defense will forward results to the State.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will be held in person.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kashmeir Lajames Sterling in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM and IN PERSON.  Case in court for a Status Conference. Defendant appears by Zoom
Defense in receipt of discovery and potential dpa offer. State confirms pending Tad Evaluation. Defense request a status date. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.
  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kashmeir Lajames Sterling in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Joel Rosenthal  to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 Per Month. 
Repayment to begin 30 Days after the conclusion of the case.  Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel. . Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kashmeir Lajames Sterling in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/7/22 @ 2:30p
